skill.name: release
skill.description: Automates version release workflow for monorepo plugins with git tag creation, version bump detection, and GitHub Release generation. Handles prefixed tagging for multiple plugins in a single repository.
skill.summary: Automates monorepo release workflow with git tags and GitHub Actions
skill.author: Codename-11

security_audit.summary: All 61 static findings are false positives. The skill provides documentation for release automation workflows using standard git and npm commands. Detected patterns include SHA256 hashes for content verification (not weak crypto), markdown examples of shell commands (not executable code), GitHub URLs for workflow references, and optional GOOGLE_API_KEY documentation. No actual security risks identified.

content.user_title: Automate releases with git tags and GitHub Actions
content.value_statement: Manually creating releases across multiple plugins is error-prone and time-consuming. This skill automates the entire release workflow including version bump detection, git tag creation, and GitHub Release generation for monorepo projects.
actual_capabilities: Identifies which plugin to release in monorepo setups with multiple packages
Analyzes commit messages to determine semantic version bump type (major, minor, patch)
Creates and pushes versioned git tags with plugin-specific prefixes
Generates proper commit messages following conventional commit format
Provides pre-release checklist verification (type-check, lint, tests, build)
Syncs development branch with main after release workflow completes
limitations: Designed specifically for monorepo workflows with prefix-based tagging convention
Requires git and npm to be installed and available in the environment
Does not directly create GitHub Releases (relies on GitHub Actions workflows)
Cannot execute release without proper git branch state and clean working directory

use_cases.title: Release a patch version after bug fixes
use_cases.description: Quickly bump and release a patch version when hotfixes or bug fixes are merged. The skill analyzes commit messages to confirm patch-level changes, then handles version bump, tagging, and push to trigger automated deployment.

use_cases.title: Release a new feature with minor version bump
use_cases.description: When new features are ready for production, invoke the skill to create a proper release. The skill detects feature commits and increments the minor version, creating tagged releases that trigger GitHub Actions workflows for deployment.

use_cases.title: Manage multi-plugin releases in monorepo
use_cases.description: For projects with multiple plugins like Stash Downloader and Stash Browser, this skill helps identify which plugin changed and creates appropriate prefixed tags for each plugin independently.

best_practices: Always start releases from the dev branch and never commit directly to main
Wait for GitHub Actions workflow to complete before syncing dev branch to avoid canceling deployments
Release plugins separately when multiple plugins have changes in the same development cycle
anti_patterns: Pushing to dev branch before the stable workflow finishes can cancel the deployment
Skipping the pre-release checklist (type-check, lint, tests, build) can lead to broken releases
Using incorrect tag prefixes that do not match plugin naming conventions breaks the automation

faq.question: How does this skill determine version bump type?
faq.answer: The skill analyzes commit messages since the last tag. Breaking changes trigger major bumps, new features trigger minor bumps, and bug fixes or documentation changes trigger patch bumps using semantic versioning conventions.

faq.question: Can I use this for non-monorepo projects?
faq.answer: The skill is optimized for monorepo workflows with plugin prefixes. For single-package repositories, you can still use the core release workflow but would need to adapt the tag naming conventions.

faq.question: What happens if I push to dev too early?
faq.answer: Pushing to dev before the stable GitHub Actions workflow completes can cancel the deployment due to concurrency groups. The skill includes explicit warnings and recommends waiting for workflow completion.

faq.question: Does this create GitHub Releases automatically?
faq.answer: The skill creates and pushes git tags. GitHub Actions workflows then automatically create GitHub Releases based on those tags, including generated changelogs and ZIP file attachments.

faq.question: What if the release workflow fails?
faq.answer: If GitHub Actions fails, you can re-push the tag to retry the workflow. The skill documentation includes troubleshooting steps and the pre-release checklist to run before releases.

faq.question: How do I configure AI-generated release notes?
faq.answer: Set the GOOGLE_API_KEY environment variable in GitHub Actions secrets. When configured, the workflow will use AI to generate release notes from commit history automatically.
